intro: Sisymbrium catamarcense, commonly known as the Catamarca mustard, is a flowering plant native to Argentina. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes other mustard plants. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. Sisymbrium catamarcense is typically found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to arid conditions.
